senses.sense_definition: A high-ranking officer in the army, air force, or marines, ranking above a lieutenant colonel and below a general.

examples.text: The <w>colonel</w> inspected the troops before they deployed for the mission.
She was promoted to <w>colonel</w> after twenty years of distinguished service in the army.

senses.sense_definition: An honorary civilian title used in some parts of the United States to recognize distinguished service or achievement, without implying actual military authority.

examples.text: Although he never served in the military, the governor made him a <w>colonel</w> for his charity work.
The famous <w>colonel</w> is better known for his fried chicken recipe than for any battle.

senses.sense_definition: To act in the manner of a colonel; to behave authoritatively or command others.

examples.text: He walked around the office <w>coloneling</w> his coworkers as if he were their boss.
Stop <w>coloneling</w> me and let me finish this task on my own.
